project.teaser: European Researchers’ Night events have been held at Trinity College Dublin every year since 2013. Co-ordinated by the Office of the Dean of Research at Trinity and in collaboration with partners at the British Council, RCSI, ADAPT, and Qualia Analytics, START 2022 and 2023...
project.objective: European Researchers’ Night events have been held at Trinity College Dublin every year since 2013. Co-ordinated by the Office of the Dean of Research at Trinity and in collaboration with partners at the British Council, RCSI, ADAPT, and Qualia Analytics, START 2022 and 2023 will expand the scope of its activities to spark deeper, more impactful engagement with the public. Based on the idea Start Talking About Research Today, START will be a hybrid event that will activate various sites around Ireland to highlight the fact that research happens everywhere and takes many forms. START will provide an opportunity for the general public and researchers to engage with each other in new ways. Through a combination of in-person and virtual activities, demonstrations, tours, talks and more, START will promote the idea that research is a living, fundamental part of our society that impacts on and involves everyone. START will work to achieve a number of specific goals: 1. Create new dialogues between researchers and the general public that will lead to a deeper, more profound and sustained engagement with each other; 2. Raise awareness of research and research careers as positive forces in our society; 3. Highlight the role of the European Union in supporting research and discovery. Public engagement and communications workshops will be offered to all MSCA-funded researchers, as well as other participants in the events on the Night. A series of activities and showcases will be held across a variety of locations to raise awareness in the months preceding European Researchers’ Night. The START project group has a wealth of talent and experience in public engagement activities, including previous ERN events, and the project team will draw on this expertise to ensure that START 2022/23 is grounded in best practice.
project.title: Start Talking About Research Today

result.title: Activities Report 2023
result.description: A full report on the activities of START 23 will be prepared and will include details of participation, success rates, and possible lessons learned for future events, aligned with metrics identified in the impact assessment report.

result.title: START website
result.description: A new website will be created and launched in advance of ERN 2022 and will be updated and maintained throughout the lifetime of the project

result.title: Activities Report 2022
result.description: A full report on the activities of START 22 will be prepared and will include details of participation success rates and possible lessons learned for future events aligned with the metrics identified in the impact assessment report

result.title: START 2022 Impact Assessment
result.description: Full impact assessment report will be prepared based on surveys conducted across START 2022 activities

result.title: Final awareness campaign report
result.description: A final awareness campaign report will be prepared to capture all of the publicity and promotional activity for START 23. It will also summarise the overall performance of the awareness campaign for START 22 and 23.

result.title: Project Management Report
result.description: The final management report will be prepared in M24 when all activities have concluded and will be reviewed by the Steering Group at its final meeting. It will provide an overview of opportunities for improvement and indicate where the project operated successfully.

result.title: Researchers at Schools 2023
result.description: A report will be prepared on the second phase of activities. It will include information on the numbers of participating researchers, schools and students as well as the locations of the schools and the topics covered. It will also include learnings from activities across the whole work package.

result.title: Scientifically Speaking Report
result.description: A full report on the programme of training workshops and skills development will be prepared to include details such as the number of researchers trained, the general success of the training programme, and opportunities for refinement in future iterations.

result.title: Impact Assessment Webinar
result.description: Impact assessment webinar with project partners and activities organisers.

result.title: START 2023 Impact Assessment
result.description: Full report will be prepared based on surveys conducted across START 2023 activities.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - START (Start Talking About Research Today)

result.title: Mid-term awareness campaign
result.description: A midterm awareness campaign report will be prepared capturing all of the publicity and promotional activity for START 22 It will include information such as website traffic social media engagement engagement with offline materials and will be accompanied by samples of promotional material used during the campaign

result.title: Researchers at Schools 2022
result.description: A report will be prepared on the first phase of activities to include information about the number of researchers schools and students that participated topics and activities covered and the location of participants The report will also include feedback from participants and recommendations for improvements in START 23

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
